alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:25PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Benton, northwestern Madison, northern Washington, southern Delaware, southeastern Mayes, northern Adair and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 825 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Rose to 3 miles northwest of Clifty. Movement was south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Tahlequah... Siloam Springs... Huntsville... Lowell... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Gentry... Elkins... Tontitown... West Fork... Lincoln... Cave Springs... Decatur... Westville... Salina... Greenland... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 55 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Arkansas...and northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
